contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|USS Dolphin}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image= |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag= {{USN flag|1835}} |Ship name= USS ''Dolphin'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=[[Philadelphia Navy Yard]] |Ship laid down= |Ship launched= 23 June 1821 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship fate= Sold, 2 December 1835 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type= [[Schooner]] |Ship displacement= {{convert|198|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} |Ship length= {{convert|88|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|23|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= {{convert|12|ft|4|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion= |Ship speed= {{convert|17|kn|lk=in}} |Ship range= |Ship complement= |Ship armament=12 × 6-pounder guns |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''Dolphin''''', a [[schooner]], was the second ship of the [[United States Navy]] named for the [[dolphin|aquatic mammal]]. ''Dolphin'' was [[ship naming and launching|launched]] on 23 June 1821 by the [[Philadelphia Navy Yard]] and sent to [[New York City]] to be readied for sea. Assigned to duty as one of two vessels making up the newly organized [[Pacific Squadron]], she sailed 8 December 1821 under the command of Lieutenant [[David Conner (naval officer)|David Conner]], in company with ship-of-the line [[USS Franklin (1815)|''Franklin'']]. ''Dolphin'' arrived at [[Valparaíso]], [[Chile]], on 6 February 1822, and cruised on the coasts of [[Ecuador]], [[Peru]], and Chile to protect American commerce and the whaling industry. Between 18 August 1825 and 24 August 1826, under the commanded by Lieut. Com. [[John Percival]], she cruised to search for the [[mutiny|mutineers]] of the American whaler ''[[Globe (whaleship)|Globe]]'', returning to [[Callao]], with the two surviving members of the mutiny. During this cruise she visited [[Hawaii]] where she assisted men of the American ship ''London'' wrecked there, and helped other American citizens in the islands. ''Dolphin'' served in the Pacific until 2 December 1835 when she was sold. == References == * {{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/d5/dolphin-ii.htm}} * {{Cite book | last = Paulding | first = Lieut. Hiram. | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Journal of the Cruise of the United States schooner “Dolphin” … in pursuit of the Mutineers of the Whale Ship “Globe” | publisher = | year = 1831 | location = New York | pages = | url = | doi = | id = | isbn = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dolphin (1821)}} [[Category:Schooners of the United States Navy]] [[Category:Ships built in Pennsylvania]] [[Category:1821 ships]]
